channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: FBI says suspect in New Orleans attack twice visited the city to conduct surveillance
item.description: The FBI says the man who allegedly carried out the New Year's Day attack visited the city in October and November, and recorded video of the area he aimed to target using "smart glasses."
item.content:encoded:
The FBI says the man who allegedly carried out the New Year's Day attack visited the city in October and November, and recorded video of the area he aimed to target using "smart glasses."

(Image credit: Gerald Herbert)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: Millions face snow and ice as a major winter storm moves across the U.S.
item.description: A major winter storm is bringing ice, snow and freezing rain from the Plains to the East Coast through Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
A major winter storm is bringing ice, snow and freezing rain from the Plains to the East Coast through Tuesday.

(Image credit: Luke Sharrett)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: NPR photos around the world that moved us in 2024
item.description: There have been touching moments — sometimes away from the headlines, and the front lines — that have moved the world this year.
item.content:encoded:
There have been touching moments — sometimes away from the headlines, and the front lines — that have moved the world this year.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Congestion pricing begins in NYC in a high stakes test for the model's U.S. viability
item.description: Congestion pricing was introduced on Sunday morning in the center of New York City — despite a late attempt by New Jersey to stop it in court.
item.content:encoded:
Congestion pricing was introduced on Sunday morning in the center of New York City — despite a late attempt by New Jersey to stop it in court.

(Image credit: Bebeto Matthews/AP)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: CNN goes on trial over its report alleging 'black market' for Afghan rescues
item.description: A CNN story about a "black market" for rescuing people from Afghanistan after the Taliban takeover is at the heart of a defamation trial that opens Monday in Florida.
item.content:encoded:
A CNN story about a "black market" for rescuing people from Afghanistan after the Taliban takeover is at the heart of a defamation trial that opens Monday in Florida.

(Image credit: CNN via Internet Archive/Screenshot by NPR)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: As Trump rewrites history, victims of the Jan. 6 riot say they feel 'betrayed'
item.description: A police officer defended the Capitol from violent rioters on Jan. 6. With President-elect Donald Trump poised to pardon the rioters, he now asks, "what did I risk my life for?"
item.content:encoded:
A police officer defended the Capitol from violent rioters on Jan. 6. With President-elect Donald Trump poised to pardon the rioters, he now asks, "what did I risk my life for?"

(Image credit: Brent Stirton)
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: How do you keep monkeys from making mischief?
item.description: In one Indian town, monkeys will steal your glasses — and give them back if you toss them a container of mango juice. It's one more sign of the impact of urbanization on the wild.
item.content:encoded:
In one Indian town, monkeys will steal your glasses — and give them back if you toss them a container of mango juice. It's one more sign of the impact of urbanization on the wild.

(Image credit: Maya Levin for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Omkar Khandekar

item.title: Getting your steps in can reduce depression, research finds
item.description: A recent study shows getting walking more may help prevent depressive symptoms. Tracking your steps may help you stay motivated, researchers say.
item.content:encoded:
A recent study shows getting walking more may help prevent depressive symptoms. Tracking your steps may help you stay motivated, researchers say.

(Image credit: Jose Gonzalez Buenaposada/iStockphoto)
item.dc:creator: Ronnie Cohen

item.title: Heavy snow brings widespread disruption across the U.K.
item.description: Heavy snow and freezing rain has brought widespread disruption across the U.K., with several major airports forced to suspend flights and many key roads in the north of England unnavigable.
item.content:encoded:
Heavy snow and freezing rain has brought widespread disruption across the U.K., with several major airports forced to suspend flights and many key roads in the north of England unnavigable.

(Image credit: Scott Heppell)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Venezuela opposition leader Edmundo González embarks on international tour
item.description: González, who the United States recognized as the winner of last year's presidential election in Venezuela, kicked off an international tour on Saturday that will take him to Washington.
item.content:encoded:
González, who the United States recognized as the winner of last year's presidential election in Venezuela, kicked off an international tour on Saturday that will take him to Washington.

(Image credit: Natacha Pisarenko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
